template.template: Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE
template.name: Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE

item.name: comp Name of the current JIT compiler

trigger.expression: {str(Client)}=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} uses suboptimal JIT compiler

item.name: comp Accumulated time spent in compilation
gc ConcurrentMarkSweep number of collections per second
gc ConcurrentMarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
gc Copy number of collections per second
gc Copy accumulated time spent in collection
gc MarkSweepCompact number of collections per second
gc MarkSweepCompact accumulated time spent in collection
gc ParNew number of collections per second
gc ParNew accumulated time spent in collection
gc PS MarkSweep number of collections per second
gc PS MarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
gc PS Scavenge number of collections per second
gc PS Scavenge accumulated time spent in collection
os Process Committed Virtual Memory Size
os Process CPU Load
item.description: returns the CPU usage of the JVM

trigger.name: 70% os Process CPU Load on {HOST.NAME}

item.name: os System CPU Load
item.description: returns the CPU usage of the whole system

trigger.expression: {nodata(5m)}=1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} is not reachable

trigger.expression: {str(Server)}<>1
trigger.name: {HOST.NAME} runs suboptimal VM type

item.name: AbandonedServers (Historical_Stats)
item.description: The web tier was unable to connect to the tcserver that the tree cache indicates is assigned to the session.

item.name: AbandonedServers (Recent_Stats)
item.description: The web tier was unable to connect to the tcserver that the tree cache indicates is assigned to the session.

trigger.name: Teamcenter Alert: Abandoned Servers exceeded threshold
trigger.description:
Connectivity problems between the web tier and server pool machine. Slow tree cache updates.
1.Make sure that the server pool machine is up and network connection is good. 2.Check webTier and Server Manager logs for TreeCache errors. You might need to restart the Server Manager and the WebTier to clear the errors.

item.name: FailedLoginAttempts (Historical_Stats)
item.description: Excessive failed login attempts have been detected.

item.name: FailedLoginAttempts (Recent_Stats)
item.description: Excessive failed login attempts have been detected.

trigger.name: Teamcenter Alert: Failed Login Attempts exceeded threshold
trigger.description:
A tcserver issue while authenticating users. Users are entering incorrect credentials. This could indicate that a system attack is in progress.
1.Examine the names of the users for the failed login attempts for a pattern that might indicate an attack. 2.Examine the enterprise tier and syslogs for a root cause of the failed login attempts.

item.name: GraveEvents (Historical_Stats)
item.description: Fatal or unexpected errors occurring in the web tier

trigger.name: Teamcenter Alert: Serious problem with webtier
trigger.description:
A configuration error or operational failure is preventing the webtier from functioning correctly.
1.Look into the problem message and take necessary step to correct the problem, or contact support

item.name: LongRunningCompleted (Historical_Stats)
item.description: Past requests that took longer than stated time period to complete

item.name: LongRunningRequests (Historical_Stats)
item.description: The web tier has been waiting for a tcserver response for the stated time period

trigger.name: Teamcenter Alert: Long-running requests detected
trigger.description:
A request is executing normally and processing a large amount of data. A tcserver is hung or is experiencing performance issues. An OutOfMemoryError in the web tier has causes problems in processing tcserver responses.
1.If there are OutOfMemoryErrors in the web tier logs tune the Java heap size and garbage collection. Reduce the thread stack size if possible. 2.To reduce notifications of normal long-running requests, increase the configured threshold for the LongRunningRequests metric.

item.name: NoServerAvailable (Historical_Stats)
item.description: The server pool was unable to assign a tcserver

item.name: NoServerAvailable (Recent_Stats)
item.description: The server pool was unable to assign a tcserver

trigger.name: Teamcenter Alert: No Server Available exceeded threshold
trigger.description:
The supply of available servers has been exhausted and server manager is in the process of starting additional tcservers. The pool configuration does not maintain enough available servers to handle a burst of requests for new tcserver sessions. Tcservers are failing to startup or taking an unusually long time to start. Tree cache update failures are occurring during server assignment.
1.Check the Server Manager log files for possible issues. 2.If tcservers are not starting, check their syslogs and look for core dumps. 3.Consider increasing PROCESS_WARM to handle larger bursts of new sessions

item.name: NumberPendingRequests (Historical_Stats)
item.description: The number of requests sent by the web tier to tcservers with pending replies has been above the configured threshold for the configured time period. Each of these requests consumes a web tier thread. If all the threads are busy, users might experience slow response times or rejected connection attempts.

trigger.name: Teamcenter Alert: Number of Pending Requests exceeded threshold
trigger.description:
There are a significant number of requests taking a long time. This could be normal for the requests involved or it could indicate a performance issue in the enterprise tier or database. The number of concurrently active clients is large enough to exceed the configured request threshold. OutOfMemory errors in the web tier can cause response processing to block.
1.Examine the web tier log for OutOfMemoryErrors. 2.Use the web tier and server manager monitoring information to detect long-running requests. If there are a lot of them, examing the enterprise tier and database for potential performance issues. 3.Consider increasing the number of request processing threads in the application server along with the configured threshold for pending requests. This will support more concurrent client requests.

item.name: ServerCommFailure (Historical_Stats)
item.description: A tcserver has closed a connection without providing a response to the web tier.

item.name: ServerCommFailure (Recent_Stats)
item.description: A tcserver has closed a connection without providing a response to the web tier.

trigger.name: Teamcenter Alert: Server Comm Failure exceeded threshold
trigger.description:
The tcserver has terminated abnormally while processing a request. The tcserver failed to allocation sufficient memory to finish sending its response.
1.Examine the syslog for errors. 2.Analyze any core dump files. 3.Determine the use case that causes the failure and contact Support.

trigger.name: TC WebApp (J2EE) is not running

macro.description: The service (http/https/etc) for port check. See "net.tcp.service" documentation page for more information: https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/current/ru/manual/config/items/itemtypes/simple_checks

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",HeapMemoryUsage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",HeapMemoryUsage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mem Heap Memory used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",NonHeapMemoryUsage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",NonHeapMemoryUsage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mem Non-Heap Memory used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp CMS Old Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Perm Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Perm Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp CMS Perm Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Code Cache",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Code Cache",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp Code Cache used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Perm Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Perm Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp Perm Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Old Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Old Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp PS Old Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp PS Perm Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Tenured Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=Tenured Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp Tenured Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=OperatingSystem",OpenFileDescriptorCount].last(0)}>({Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=OperatingSystem",MaxFileDescriptorCount].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% os Opened File Descriptor Count used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=ParNew",CollectionCount].last(0)}<{Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=ConcurrentMarkSweep",CollectionCount].last(0)}
trigger.name: gc Concurrent Mark Sweep in fire fighting mode on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=Copy",CollectionCount].last(0)}<{Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=MarkSweepCompact",CollectionCount].last(0)}
trigger.name: gc Mark Sweep Compact in fire fighting mode on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=PS Scavenge",CollectionCount].last(0)}<{Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,name=PS MarkSweep",CollectionCount].last(0)}
trigger.name: gc PS Mark Sweep in fire fighting mode on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",HeapMemoryUsage.committed].last(0)}={Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",HeapMemoryUsage.max].last(0)}
trigger.name: mem Heap Memory fully committed on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",NonHeapMemoryUsage.committed].last(0)}={Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=Memory",NonHeapMemoryUsage.max].last(0)}

trigger.name: mp PS Old Gen fully committed on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen",Usage.committed].last(0)}={Template SPLM TC Web Application Server_J2EE:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}
